articles.headline: Take Note: Computing Takes Up Pen, Again
articles.snippet: An ambitious new type of pen-based computer system could bridge the gap between paper and the digital world.
articles.abstract: An ambitious new type of pen-based computer system could bridge the gap between paper and the digital world.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, May 29 — For more than two decades, the dream of controlling a computer with a pen has seduced and, more often than not, frustrated some of the biggest luminaries in the technology pantheon, including Bill Gates and Steve Jobs.

articles.headline: A Rocky Start for Nevada’s New Governor
articles.snippet: A string of travails has taken a toll on Gov. Jim Gibbons, who had a 28 percent approval rating in a recent poll.
articles.abstract: A string of travails has taken a toll on Gov. Jim Gibbons, who had a 28 percent approval rating in a recent poll.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARSON CITY, Nev., May 24 — Life these days for Gov. Jim Gibbons of Nevada might kindly be described as suboptimal.

articles.headline: Is Wal-Mart Too Cheap for Its Own Good?
articles.snippet: A confidential report concludes that the chain’s reputation for discounts has worked against its efforts to move upscale.
articles.abstract: A confidential report concludes that the chain’s reputation for discounts has worked against its efforts to move upscale.
articles.lead_paragraph: Low prices, it turns out, can be bad for business.

articles.headline: Truth, Fiction and Lou Dobbs
articles.snippet: If the arguments of Lou Dobbs were really so good, surely you think he would be able to stick to the facts?
articles.abstract: If the arguments of Lou Dobbs were really so good, surely you think he would be able to stick to the facts?
articles.lead_paragraph: The whole controversy involving Lou Dobbs and leprosy started with a “60 Minutes” segment a few weeks ago.

articles.headline: Now, Spitzer Is Warming to Wall St.
articles.snippet: Gov. Eliot Spitzer of New York is creating a commission focused on streamlining regulation in the financial services industry.
articles.abstract: Gov. Eliot Spitzer of New York is creating a commission focused on streamlining regulation in the financial services industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: As attorney general of New York, Eliot Spitzer made a name for himself as a tough cop willing to take on deep-pocketed industries like Wall Street and insurance. Now, as governor, he may be making life a little easier for them in an effort to keep financial services in New York competitive in the global market.

articles.headline: Equity Firm to Acquire Net Retailer
articles.snippet: Madison Dearborn Partners will acquire the CDW Corporation, a leading online computer reseller, for $7.3 billion.
articles.abstract: Madison Dearborn Partners will acquire the CDW Corporation, a leading online computer reseller, for $7.3 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: The CDW Corporation, a leading online computer reseller, said yesterday that it had agreed to sell itself to Madison Dearborn Partners for $7.3 billion in cash, the latest big acquisition by a private equity firm.

articles.headline: In North Iraq, Sunni Arabs Drive Out Kurds
articles.snippet: Conflict between Arabs and Kurds is intensifying in Mosul, adding another dimension to the civil war.
articles.abstract: Conflict between Arabs and Kurds is intensifying in Mosul, adding another dimension to the civil war.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSUL, Iraq — The letter tossed into Mustafa Abu Bakr Muhammad’s front yard got right to the point.

articles.headline: Bumped Fliers and No Plan B
articles.snippet: So many planes are expected to be full this summer that bumped passengers could end up waiting days for a seat.
articles.abstract: So many planes are expected to be full this summer that bumped passengers could end up waiting days for a seat.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX — The summer travel season is under way, and so many planes are expected to be full that, if you are bumped, you could end up waiting days for a seat on another flight to the same destination.
